Agent.definition: someone or something that acts or exerts power
Agent.origin: [where the heads of departments are the political… s of the executive, merely to execute the will of the president " Marbury v. Madison , 5 U.S. 137 (1803)"]

1.definition: someone or something that acts or exerts powera moving force in achieving some result

2.definition: a person guided or instigated by another in some action [where the heads of departments are the political…of the executive, merely to execute the will of the president ", 5 U.S. 137 (1803)"] see also

3 a.definition: a person or entity (as an employee or independent contractor) authorized to act on behalf of and under the control of another in dealing with third parties see also,,compare,,

apparent agent.definition: an agent acting under an agency by estoppel

bar·gain·ing agent.definition: a labor union that represents the employees in a bargaining unit in negotiating with their employer through collective bargaining

business agent.definition: an agent that handles business affairs for another person or organizationa paid official of a union who carries on union business between the employees and the employer

del cre·de·re agent.definition: an agent that guarantees to his or her principal that third parties involved in the transaction will pay or perform

exclusive agent.definition: an agent acting under an exclusive agency

general agent.definition: an agent acting under a general agency

legislative agent.definition: an agent (as for an interest group) that lobbies a legislature esp. professionally

managing agent.definition: an agent or employee of a corporation or other business entity who has a position that involves the use of judgment and discretion and who is considered under the law as capable of accepting service of process and answering questions under cross-examination on behalf of the business entity

ostensible agent.definition: an agent acting under an agency by estoppel

special agent.definition: an agent authorized to do one or more specific acts under particular instructions or within restrictions implied by the nature of the authorized actsan agent acting under a special agency comparein this entry

transfer agent.definition: an officer, bank, or trust company that acts on behalf of a publicly held corporation in handling the transfer of stock and other securities and keeping records of the owners

universal agent.definition: an agent acting under a general agency

sub_terms.b: a representative of a corporation designated to accept service of process on behalf of the corporation usually as required by statute
sub_terms.c: a person or organization that finds buyers or tenants for real estate owners usually for a commission
sub_terms.d: an independent sales or service representative of an insurance company compare

4 a.definition: a representative, emissary, or official of a government [a diplomatic ]

sub_terms.b: an employee of a government agency usually that is involved in law enforcement [seized by DEA]
